meanings.sent1: The whang of the door slamming shut startled me.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud whang as the hammer hit the metal.
meanings.sent3: The whang of the bell made everyone jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The thunder made a whang that echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The whang of the fireworks filled the night sky with sound.

meanings.sent1: He whanged the ball with all his might, sending it flying.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally whanged her elbow on the table corner.
meanings.sent3: The chef whanged the dough to flatten it for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The boxer whanged a powerful punch that knocked out his opponent.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter whanged the nail into the wood with a single strike.

meanings.definition: A thick slice of meat or fish
meanings.sent1: The sandwich was filled with a juicy whang of ham.
meanings.sent2: She cut a thick whang of salmon for the dinner recipe.
meanings.sent3: The whang of beef on the plate made his mouth water.
meanings.sent4: The chef placed a savory whang of steak on the grill.
meanings.sent5: The deli offered a delicious whang of turkey for the sandwiches.

meanings.sent1: The car whanged down the road, leaving a trail of dust behind.
meanings.sent2: She whanged through the crowd to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel whanged up the tree to escape the chasing cat.
meanings.sent4: The wind whanged through the trees, bending them in its path.
meanings.sent5: The athlete whanged across the finish line, winning the race.
